intro: Anthocleista macrantha, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical shrub native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing small, smooth seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in local healing practices.
